issue.title: dnf-automatic is sending me an email with empty body after updates
issue.body:
Hello,

so in /etc/dnf/automatic.conf i have 

`[emitters]`
emit_via = command_email
`[command_email]`
command_format = "mailx -S sendwait -s {subject} -r {email_from} {email_to}"

the email is being send fine but it's body is empty and the strange thing is it sends 2 dat files as attachments this is not normal if you ask me ?

comment.body:
> Hello,
> 
> Even with the code change in output.py found #2007 not working output still messed up with ansi shell color codes.

Hi, have you tried both the patch from #2007 and adding the:
```
[base]
color=never
```
... to the `/etc/dnf/automatic.conf`? For me it seems working, at least the stdio for `dnf-automatic` started to produce a correct output without coloring codes ...

commits.message:
repoquery: Do not translate time format strings (RhBz: 2245773)

Given that the `--queryformat` option is commonly used to generate
machine-readable outputs from repoquery, we should ensure that the
output remains stable regardless of the locale used.

This partially reverts commit 1daf3467e60bbd54998cab79bcabe4e3a8d4d153.

= changelog =
msg:           Do not translate repoquery time format strings
type:          bugfix
resolves:      https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2245773

issue.title: Incorrect «--resolve» for set of packages, like «libtool rpm-build»
issue.body:
Consider the case: 
* we need to download set of packages with dependencies
* then install it from local repo
* let it be just couple of packages → «libtool» «rpm-build»


I try:
* «`dnf download  --downloaddir ./dir4rpms --resolve libtool rpm-build`»  (according #1998 `--resolve` without `--alldeps` should work) 
* creating offline repo with «`baseurl=file://$PWD/dir4rpms`» 
* installing from local offline repo «`dnf install  --disablerepo="*" --enablerepo="offline" libtool rpm-build`» — failed.

```
Error:
 Problem: package redhat-rpm-config-262-1.fc39.noarch from offline requires (annobin-plugin-gcc if gcc), but none of the providers can be installed
  - package redhat-rpm-config-262-1.fc39.noarch from offline requires (gcc-plugin-annobin if gcc), but none of the providers can be installed
  - package rpm-build-4.19.0-1.fc39.x86_64 from offline requires system-rpm-config, but none of the providers can be installed
  - package libtool-2.4.7-7.fc39.x86_64 from offline requires gcc(major) = 13, but none of the providers can be installed
```

----

I checked it on FC37, FC38, FC39

Script to reproduce:
https://gist.github.com/belonesox/0ff847cb441b13f26c697ad0f07c7d03

```bash
#!/bin/sh
set +ex
rm -rf ./dir4rpms
toolbox rm -f test-fc39 -y || true
SETPACKAGES="libtool rpm-build"
#dnf-utils rpm-build
toolbox create test-fc39 --distro fedora --release 39 
toolbox run -c test-fc39 sudo dnf install createrepo -y
toolbox run -c test-fc39 sudo dnf download  --downloaddir ./dir4rpms --arch=x86_64  --arch=x86_64 --arch=noarch --resolve $SETPACKAGES -y

#Does not work either
#toolbox run -c test-fc39 sudo dnf download  --downloaddir ./dir4rpms --arch=x86_64  --arch=x86_64 --arch=noarch --resolve libtool --resolve rpm-build -y

toolbox run -c test-fc39 sudo createrepo ./dir4rpms
toolbox run -c test-fc39 sudo bash -c 'sudo echo -e "[offline]\nname=offline\nbaseurl=file://$PWD/dir4rpms/\nenabled=0\ngpgcheck=0\nrepo_gpgcheck=0\n" > /etc/yum.repos.d/offline.repo'
toolbox run -c test-fc39 sudo dnf install --refresh --nogpgcheck --disablerepo="*" --enablerepo="offline"  -y --allowerasing $SETPACKAGES
```

Is it bug or feature?
What I am doing wrong?

comment.body: On the other hand, resolving downloaded packages independently enables us to download even conflicting packages. That means to resolve this issue we need to make selection of the algorithm configurable.

commits.message:
automatic: Fix applying the color option

The `color` option value wasn't passed in `dnf-automatic` usage so far.

In the standard `dnf` command, the `Term` object is created before parsing the entire configuration, including command-line parameters. The `Term` is reinitialized within `Cli.configure` if the `color` option value was changed. In `dnf-automatic`, where configuration is processed in a single place, we can directly pass the value from the configuration.

pull_request.title: automatic: Fix applying the color option
pull_request.body:
The `color` option value wasn't passed in `dnf-automatic` usage so far.

In the standard `dnf` command, the `Term` object is created before parsing the entire configuration, including command-line parameters. The `Term` is reinitialized within `Cli.configure` if the `color` option value was changed. In `dnf-automatic`, where configuration is processed in a single place, we can directly pass the value from the configuration.

This is a follow-up to the #2003.

comment.body:
Hello ,

Yeah those look like andi shell color codes making me think think that dnf-automatic is trying to respect the colorized output the dnf command produces (eg dnf check-update which produces a green list if updates are available) however dnf-automatic is failing to respect the color codes .

For me personal the colorized output is nice to have but can be missed however i do want to know when dnf-automatic installed updates.

issue.title: dnf-automatic is sending me an email with empty body after updates
issue.body:
Hello,

so in /etc/dnf/automatic.conf i have 

`[emitters]`
emit_via = command_email
`[command_email]`
command_format = "mailx -S sendwait -s {subject} -r {email_from} {email_to}"

the email is being send fine but it's body is empty and the strange thing is it sends 2 dat files as attachments this is not normal if you ask me ?

comment.body: > > > hello, > > > Bad news command_email is sending .dat attachments again and the email emitter does show the email body but you can see the formatting is all messed up i did not change anything hmmmmù this is getting weird and very annoying > > > > > > It appears that the output includes color formatting characters for the terminal. You might just need to override the coloring format in the `base` section of `automatic.conf` to `color = never`. More about that [here](https://dnf.readthedocs.io/en/latest/conf_ref.html#main-options-colors). Let me know if this helps. > > Actually I tried to test this inside the container, and while changing the `color` option is respected with the `dnf` command, it appears not to work for `dnf-automatic`. Let me take some time to look at this. So, there really is a bug that the `color` option value is not respected in the `dnf-automatic`. I've created a [PR](https://github.com/rpm-software-management/dnf/pull/2007) to fix this issue.

pull_request.title: automatic: Fix applying the color option
pull_request.body:
The `color` option value wasn't passed in `dnf-automatic` usage so far.

In the standard `dnf` command, the `Term` object is created before parsing the entire configuration, including command-line parameters. The `Term` is reinitialized within `Cli.configure` if the `color` option value was changed. In `dnf-automatic`, where configuration is processed in a single place, we can directly pass the value from the configuration.

issue.title: dnf-automatic is sending me an email with empty body after updates
issue.body:
Hello,

so in /etc/dnf/automatic.conf i have 

`[emitters]`
emit_via = command_email
`[command_email]`
command_format = "mailx -S sendwait -s {subject} -r {email_from} {email_to}"

the email is being send fine but it's body is empty and the strange thing is it sends 2 dat files as attachments this is not normal if you ask me ?

comment.body: > > hello, > > Bad news command_email is sending .dat attachments again and the email emitter does show the email body but you can see the formatting is all messed up i did not change anything hmmmmù this is getting weird and very annoying > > It appears that the output includes color formatting characters for the terminal. You might just need to override the coloring format in the `base` section of `automatic.conf` to `color = never`. More about that [here](https://dnf.readthedocs.io/en/latest/conf_ref.html#main-options-colors). Let me know if this helps. Actually I tried to test this inside the container, and while changing the `color` option is respected with the `dnf` command, it appears not to work for `dnf-automatic`. Let me take some time to look at this.

comment.body: > hello, > > Bad news command_email is sending .dat attachments again and the email emitter does show the email body but you can see the formatting is all messed up i did not change anything hmmmmù this is getting weird and very annoying It appears that the output includes color formatting characters for the terminal. You might just need to override the coloring format in the `base` section of `automatic.conf` to `color = never`. More about that [here](https://dnf.readthedocs.io/en/latest/conf_ref.html#main-options-colors). Let me know if this helps.

issue.title: [Question] [API] How to query default and enabled stream and profile of a module?
issue.body:
`libdnf.module.ModulePackage` objects have the module, stream and profile names, thru methods `getName`, `getStream` and `getProfiles`, plus the stream default profile (if there is), via `getDefaultProfile`.

Are there methods and/or attributes, or maybe other classes, which inform if a stream is enabled and/or default, and which is the enabled profile?

I could work it around by a system call to the shell with `dnf module` commands and a quite convoluted `awk` filter. But, obviously, this gets cumbersome and results in an additional (and probably avoidable) system call.

comment.body:
I think that in your code is missing part related to loading metadata

Something like - 
```
module_container = libdnf.module.ModulePackageContainer(allArch, installRoot, system_arch)

yaml_path = "/home/jmracek/Projects/yaml-converter/output_yamls/fedora-modular/modules.yaml"
repoid = "fedora-modular"
with open(yaml_path, 'r') as yaml_file:
    module_container.add(yaml_file.read(), repoid)

module_container.addPlatformPackage(None, "", "platform:f31");
```

This is not nice.

Or module container could be filled automatically by DNF. In this case I would recommend to request public property for `base._moduleContainer`

```
with dnf.base.Base() as base:
    base.conf.cacheonly=True
    base.conf.read(priority=dnf.conf.PRIO_MAINCONFIG)

    base.read_all_repos()
    base.repos.all().set_progress_bar(dnf.cli.progress.MultiFileProgressMeter(fo=sys.stdout))
    base.fill_sack(load_system_repo=True, load_available_repos=True)

    module_container = base._moduleContainer
```

commits.message: doc: Add filelists entry to API and configuration docs

cli: Setup filelists from the configuration

Besides configuring the request for loading the filelists metadata based on demands from individual commands, these changes also add support for setting it up globally using the filelists configuration option.

comment.body: Thank you! I've created a follow-up issue for the suggested documentation changes and I am closing this as it's resolved.

issue.title: automatic: Improve docs with suggestions on email encoding issues
issue.body:
Based on the distribution used, there might by an additional configuration needed for the email emitter in dnf-automatic. We could provide some suggestions to automatic man pages how to deal with these issues.

This is a follow-up to #2003.

pull_request.title: Dnf automatic email on error
pull_request.body:
The changes implemented in this PR are for: https://github.com/rpm-software-management/dnf/issues/1918

The changes allows the emitters to invoke when a DNF error occurs. I tested this out by setting the email_via = command_email and command_format = "echo {subject} {body} > /tmp/dnf_error" in the /etc/dnf/automatic.conf file. When I removed by GPG keys from the enabled repositories and run the def-automatic command it created the error file with the error description.

repo.name: dnf
repo.description: Package manager based on libdnf and libsolv. Replaces YUM.

repo.name: dnf
repo.description: Package manager based on libdnf and libsolv. Replaces YUM.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -72,14 +78,20 @@ def notify_downloaded(self):
         assert self._available_msg
         self._downloaded = True
 
+    def notify_error(self, msg):
+        self._error = True
+        self._error_msg = msg
comment.body: Not necessarily. It's possible to leave an empty string as the msg variable; however, when the _prepare_msg function is called, "An error has occurred on <system_name>" will be the first thing on the error message before appending the body. If needed, I can add a default value to self._error_msg but it would be a generic error message.

pull_request.title: Dnf automatic email on error
pull_request.body:
The changes implemented in this PR are for: https://github.com/rpm-software-management/dnf/issues/1918

The changes allows the emitters to invoke when a DNF error occurs. I tested this out by setting the email_via = command_email and command_format = "echo {subject} {body} > /tmp/dnf_error" in the /etc/dnf/automatic.conf file. When I removed by GPG keys from the enabled repositories and run the def-automatic command it created the error file with the error description.
